title: Ticket #5829: Issues with linux kernel tuning script
description:
• rmem_max should be 10MiB, not 10 * 1014 * 1024 bytes.
  • we should log the actual file /proc being modified, not our name for it.
remarks:
2016-Aug-05 11:22:23 by tlmiller:
Consider backporting to 8.4?

2016-Aug-05 11:22:44 by tpdownes:
Worth evaluating my claim that the actual modification being made is not useful in the absence of other changes to, e.g., net.ipv4.tcp_rmem and net.ipv4.tcp_wmem.

2016-Aug-05 11:38:29 by tlmiller:
For the record: 

#
# Likewise, the central manager (collector) needs have large UDP buffers.
# Increase the maximum allowed size of networks receive buffers.
#
MAX_RECEIVE_BUFFER=10485760

Do you have a reason to believe that UDP won't be affected without additional tweakings?

2016-Aug-05 11:43:20 by tlmiller:
ToddT wants at least the size change backported. We should also review the log message changes and backport to 8.4 if they're safe (I think they are, but I wrote the code, so...).

2016-Aug-05 16:13:59 by tlmiller:
Code approved verbally by TimT.
